page.title: 02Dartmoor Inn to Brat Tor
page.content: Just to the north of the {Dartmoor {Inn }there is a rough track just negotiable by a motor vehicle. Following this track one soon comes to the top of {High Down } and can look down on the {River Lydd, }and up at {Brat Tor}towering above. To the north of Brat Tor is Arms Tor, but one cannot miss Brat Tor, since it is crowned with a large cross called {Widgery Cross. One can cross the Lydd either by the stepping stones or on the wooden bridge, and start the ascent up the rocky sides of Brat Tor. This is a pull up, and one needs good boots, especially since most of the boulders are covered by Wortleberry. The top of the tor is a classic tor, a pile of granite surmounted by the cross. From the top a fine view of Devon is obtained.
